description.narrative: This project aims to establish a sustainable protected area financing system, with associated management structures, systems and capacities needed to ensure the effective use of generated revenues for priority biodiversity conservation needs.

participating-org.narrative: Egypt - Ministry of State for Environmental Affairs

description.narrative: seat of a first-order administrative division

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: At project end, achieved levels of revenue are within 10% of projection and the trend in growth rates sets the NCS on track to meet the optimal scenario.

comment.narrative: Financing of protected areas is below 20% of basic scenario.

Support local communities in South Sinai by completing El Gharana village and relocation of the local communities for better living conditions. support eco-tourism in South Sinai in the Blue Hole by upgrading the protected area and providing basic services to the visitors. Complete and implement he permit system into the protected areas. Apply the E-ticketing.

Due to unforeseen circumstances the project did not complete the El Gharana village relocation of the local communities however, the financial strategy of protected areas was completed and E-ticketing was applied thus increasing income to the protected areas which in turn will help in the upgrading of the areas. Upgrading of the Blue Hole completed with basic services making it a world class eco-touristic site. Permit system applied thus contributing to the nature conversation.

The introduction of entrance fees at Wadi El Gemal NP was applied The Development of Wadi Degla & Petrified Forest Sustainable Financing and Management Model completed The Development of Blue Hole Dive Site Sustainable Financing and Management plan completed with the necessary infrastructure to support the system. Review and update of Wadi Degla camping fees and of PA concession pricing system was applied. This resulted in income generation for the protected areas.
